page.title: 08MEDIA IN PLAYING PLACE/KEA
page.content: All families in Playing Place have a {radio}on which they listen to National Radio Programmes or possibly Radio Cornwall.Most cars have radios too. Very few houses are without {television}which is, for many, the major source of entertainment. Programmes are transmitted from London, Plymouth and other large cities.Some people have{video recorders. Videos films can be hired from the garage in Playing Place. About half of the people read a National Daily{newspaper}and the same number buy The West Briton, a local weekly, which contains a lot of advertising. Free advertising{gazettes are delivered to most houses. Kea Church publish a monthly Parish{ {magazine}. A travelling{library van visits most villages in our area once a fortnight.
